intro: Ctenium camposum, commonly known as the Brazilian sandgrass, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or coastal areas, showcasing adaptations to saline and arid conditions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. Ctenium camposum plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for local wildlife.
